column4: FATAL: Error inserting ndiswrapper (/lib/modules/2.6.10-5-386/kernel/drivers/net/ndiswrapper/ndiswrapper.ko): Operation not permitted
Any idea why I get this ? Maybe becasue of failed update I had today ?
have you tried doing a depmod -ae?
or if you just recently upgraded kernel ... reboot
I rebooted. I tries depmod -ae , it is still the same
it is a pretty stupid error : Operation not permitted , I am root, what else does it want ???
I have seen that before if the modules were not build with same symbols as the current running kernel
but those modules are the ones from the linux-restricted package?
so what now ? apt-get upgrade ?  Install updates ?
I have plain hoary + some updates
You could try that. Some reasons for that happening: ndiswrapper module compiled with symbols from a different kernel ... and .. well ... thats it!
thats all I can think of
I had an update of 105 packages today, but i failed for some reason :-(
